00001 /* modes.h
00002         -- header file for vibrational modes */
00003 
00004 /* Begun 20070519 by Lachele Foley
00005 This file contains structures to be used for descriptions of
00006 vibrational modes.  Most of the definitions should be obvious
00007 to most folks who are concerned with vibrations.  But, a few,
00008 like the "extent of" descriptors, will not be so evident.  
00009 Eventually, I'll document how they are determined -- they
00010 basically boil down to normalized dot products, but the exact
00011 definitions might be more subtle. */
00012 //#include "molecules.h"
00013 
00014 typedef struct {
00015         int i; // array index
00016         int j; // internal index 
00017         int k; // some other index
00018 } intset; // intended to use in assignment arrays for indexing to mode details
00019 
00020 typedef struct {
00021         int ct; // mode class type
00022 // Class types are indexed by number, e.g.:
00023 //      0       stretch  
00024 //      1       anglebend 
00025 //      2       torsion 
00026 //      3       ringmotion
00027         int ce; // class entry ... 
00028         int i ; // other index
00029 // the index for of a certain type (e.g., stretch) in the vibmode array
00030         int C; // complexity for this mode entry
00031         double w; // weight (intensity, extent, etc.) for this mode
00032 } vibindex;
00033 
00034 typedef struct{
00035         int i; // general index
00036         int nv; // number of va's
00037         vibindex *vi; // indices for mode details
00038         molindex mi; // info about the atom
00039 } vibaddr; // for holding addresses in a vibmode array
00040 
00041 typedef struct {
00042         int i; // index
00043         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00044         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00045         double e; // extent of stretch in motion
00046         molindex  A,B;
00047         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00048 } stretch; // description of stretch
00049 
00050 typedef struct {
00051         int i; // index
00052         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00053         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00054         double e; // extent of angle bend in motion
00055         molindex  A,B,C; 
00056         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00057 } anglebend; // description of anglebend
00058 
00059 typedef struct {
00060         int i; // index
00061         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00062         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00063         double e; // extent of torsion in motion
00064         molindex  A,B,C;
00065         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00066 } torsion; // description of torsion
00067 
00068 typedef struct {
00069         int i; // index
00070         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description for mode
00071         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00072         double e; // extent of ring-portion of overall motion
00073         double pvp; // motion parallel (~0) or perpendicular (~1) to plane
00074         double par; // breathing-type or side-to-side motion (if parallel)
00075         double sym; // symmetric (~1) or antisymmetric (~0) (par or perp)
00076         int symZ,symXY; // symmetries in the Z direction and XY plane
00077         int na; // number of main atoms involved
00078         molindex  *mi; //na of these
00079         int nc; // number of vectormag_3D sets 
00080         vectormag_3D *c; // nc of these (e.g., direction intensities of atoms)
00081 } ringmotion; // description of ring-related motion
00082 
00083 typedef struct {
00084         int i,j,k; // indices -- molecule number, file entry number, etc.
00085         double f; // frequency for this mode (usually in wavenumbers)
00086         double I; // intensity of mode, user-defined
00087         double IR; // IR intensity of the mode (absorption, preferrably)
00088         double RA; // RAMAN intensity of the mode (absorption, preferrably)
00089         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description
00090         int C; // complexity factor (number of different motions represented)
00091         int ns; // number of stretches in mode
00092         int na; // number of angle bends in mode
00093         int nt; // number of torsions in mode
00094         int nr; // number of ring-related motions in mode
00095         stretch *s; // stretches (ns of these)
00096         anglebend *a; // number of angle bends (na of these)
00097         torsion *t; // torsions (nt of these)
00098         ringmotion *r; // ring-related motions (nr of these)
00099         double te; // extent of translational character in mode
00100         double re; // extent of rotational character in mode
00101         vectormag_3D tv, rv, mvs; // translation vec, rotation vec, sum of motion vectors
00102         double maxmag; // maximum vector magnitude in native set
00103         double modemax; // maximum s-a-t score in mode set (used to scale vectors to max of 1)
00104         double maxmodemag; // vector magnitude for the modemax vector
00105         double maxKEmag; // for the larges s-a-t assignment, the KE along that assignment
00106 } vibmode; // description of a vibrational mode 
00107 
00108 
00109 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure for two equivalent atoms
00110         int C; //complexity
00111         int ns2,na2,nt2; // for atom list with unknown symmetry
00112         intset *s2,*a2,*t2; 
00113         int ns2s;
00114         intset *s2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00115         int ns2a;
00116         intset *s2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric
00117         int na2s;
00118         intset *a2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00119         int na2a;
00120         intset *a2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric 
00121         int nt2s;
00122         intset *t2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00123         int nt2a;
00124         intset *t2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric
00125         double s2se,s2ae,a2se,a2ae,t2se,t2ae; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00126 } twoassign; // description of a vibrational mode 
00127 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure for two ring-related motions
00128         int C; //complexity
00129         int nopsA;
00130         intset *opsA; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms), single atom info
00131 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00132         int nopss;
00133         intset  *opss; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms) -- symmetric
00134         int nopsa;
00135         intset  *opsa; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms) -- asymmetric
00136         double opsSe,opsPe,opsDe; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00137         int nopdA;
00138         intset  *opdA; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms), single atom info
00139 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00140         int nopdA1G;
00141         intset  *opdA1G; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms) -- A-1-G symmetry
00142         int nopdOth;
00143         intset  *opdOth; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms) -- some other symmetry
00144         double opdse,opdae; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00145         int nrbA;
00146         intset  *rbA; // ring breathing motion, single atom info
00147 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00148         int nrbs;
00149         intset  *rbs; // ring breathing motion, symmetric
00150         int nrba;
00151         intset  *rba; // ring breathing motion, asymmetric
00152 // REGARDING O and P assignments:
00153 //      Atom A is exocyclic and bound to endocyclic B
00154 //      R is the vector for the radius from ring center to B
00155 //      T is the tangent at B, always oriented the same, e.g. (counter)clockwise
00156 //      M is the cross product of R and T (M points perpendicular to the ring plane)
00157 // If the motion vector is orthogonal to M, it is type O (moves along ring perimeter)
00158 // If the motion vector is parallel to M, it is type P (moves _|_ to ring perimeter)
00159         int nroA;
00160         intset  *roA; // ring-related O motion (not stretch), single atom info
00161 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00162         int nros;
00163         intset  *ros; // ring-related O motion, symmetric
00164         int nroa;
00165         intset  *roa; // ring-related O motion, asymmetric
00166         double rbAe,rbse,rbae,roAe,rose,roae;  // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00167         int nrpA;
00168         intset  *rpA; // ring-related P motion, (not breathing) single atom info
00169 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00170         int nrps;
00171         intset  *rps; // ring-related P motion, symmetric
00172         int nrpa;
00173         intset  *rpa; // ring-related P motion, asymmetric
00174         int nrso;
00175         intset  *rso; // other ring-related stretches
00176         double rpAe,rpse,rpae,rsoe;  // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00177 } ringassign; // description of a vibrational mode 
00178 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure
00179         int i; // index
00180         int n; // index (intended as atom index for per-atom info)
00181         int loc; // location index (endocyclic, exocyclic H, etc.)
00182         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description
00183         int C; // complexity = number of motion types present 
00184 // the following pairs are the number per each and their index in an external vibmode array
00185 //      Simple motions
00186         int ns;
00187         intset *s; // plain stretches in mode 
00188         int na;
00189         intset *a; // plain angle bends in mode
00190         int nt;
00191         intset *t; // plain torsions in mode
00192         int nw;
00193         intset *w; // number of plain wags, pointers to locations
00194         int nrk;
00195         intset *rk; // number of plain rocks, pointers to locations
00196         double se,ae,te,we,rke; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00197 //      Motions of two coupled atoms and motions involving rings
00198         int nr, ntwo; // numbers of rings or pairs of coupled atoms
00199         ringassign *r; // ring assignment structures
00200         twoassign *two; // structures for coupled motions
00201 } assignment;
00202 
00203 typedef struct{
00204         int i,j,k; // indices
00205         molindex mi; // where this atom is
00206         double a,b,c; // numbers of interest
00207         char *Desc; // description 
00208         //intset aset,bset; // oh, why not...
00209 } assn_brief;
00210 
00211 typedef struct { // info tied to atom number
00212         int i,j; // index (to an assignment array, perhaps)
00213         double I; // normalized motion intensity for this atom (regular intensity is elsewhere)
00214         int ns, *s; // number of significant stretches, indices for those in VS
00215         int na, *a; // number of significant anglebends, indices for those in VS
00216         int nt, *t; // number of significant torsions, indices for those in VS
00217         int loc; // the location of this atom
00218 } atommode;

00220 void get_transition_intensity(molecule *M, int xl, int vl, vibmode *v, atype *ATYPE, FILE *F);
